cyclone.name: TAMMY
cyclone.current_location: about 460 mi (735 km) E of the Windward Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn WNW tonight then NW Friday night–Saturday, passing through the Leeward Islands and then lifting northward over the open Atlantic east of Puerto Rico and the Virgin Islands.

weather_observation.watch_coast: Barbados, Dominica, Martinique and Guadeloupe under Tropical Storm Watch
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lesser Antilles from northern Windwards through Leewards; swell field and rain shield extending westward to the U.S. and British Virgin Islands and eastern Puerto Rico
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force gusts (35–45 kt) possible Saturday night into Sunday as Tammy passes well to the east–northeast.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Long-period swells may produce hazardous surf and rip currents; significant surge at St. Croix not expected.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands may bring 1–2 inches with isolated 4 inches, causing brief urban or flash flooding in poor-drainage areas.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas in and near the harbor area could disrupt vessel operations and pilotage from late Saturday through Sunday.
